title: Obamas Head To Connecticut As Tight Governor's Race Nears Close
teaser: Incumbent Dannel Malloy and Republican rival Tom Foley are neck and neck; the race is so close that both the president and first lady will visit the state in the next few days. NPR's Melissa Block talks to Hartford Courant political reporter Daniela Altimari about the race.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
